Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I didn't test, but the code looks good.

Removed reviewer Derick Montague with the following votes:

* Code-Review+1 by Derick Montague <derick.montague@ibm.com>

Label elements should only be used to associate descriptive text with an input. 

Why not an <h3> element? <label class="inline h3 column">{{dev.name}}</label>

Label elements should only be used to associate descriptive text with an input. 

Is this helper text needed? It is better to use the action text in the button rather having to explain to the user. This solution works for sighted users only since there is no association with the action element this text is describing.
Is there a reason we need to use the input button type rather than a button element? It would be preferred remain consistent throughout the app, but that is a small nitpick.
All input elements require associated <label> elements to meet accessibility requirements. Can you add labels for these inputs, please?
This isn't a class we use in the app, btn-secondary would be the class to use for this button. :)
Can you get rid of these trailing spaces?
nitpick (and don't need to change): should be fixed in the commit before
A lot of console logs.. All of these are needed?

Can we change this to use a Bootstrap modal? There are accessibility/usability issues with our custom modals. There are examples of the Bootstrap modal on the power operations and user account page https://angular-ui.github.io/bootstrap/#!#modal

The label element is meant for associating a form element like an input to it's label text. If this message is not associated with a label, it is the the semantic element to use. I think a

element would be a better semantic choice. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/label
why var instead of const since these are not changed after being assigned?

Using

elements is fine, but I would expect the label and associated input to be contained in each

element. We have not done a good job of creating reusable forms. There is a base started, but it needs to be expanded upon. What is important here is that the spacing between the sections is 1.5rem. Using a label above an input should inherit the proper spacing above the input.

sorry, kind of annoying with this bootstrap modal, but we've been adding an empty catch here because bootstrap throws an error whenever the modal is $dismiss-ed or if the overlay is clicked (which also closes the modal). Would you mind just adding the empty catch? Only the $close method seems to resolve the promise. 

.result.then().catch(function(){ //do nothing })
Could you add a 'X' close button?
It doesn't hurt to have this, but it is not necessary. All the "h2" class does is set the font-size and margins to the same as an <h2> element. Since it is an <h2> element, it isn't needed.
